author: plexiglass
title: Unique  Experience
review:
I played this many years ago when I was a toddler and honestly I did not remember about it until I came across it on this site.

You can tell Lego was experimenting with something new. In this series, you had modular pieces, mostly joints that connected with each other, and you tightened the built-in hinges with a "screwdriver" that came with it. 

It was sometimes a bit confusing to put together. Here you got some sort of backhoe/dump truck combination. It was fun to play with, even with non-lego toys, since it is not very "Lego" integrated to begin with, which might have been a problem since it didn't really match the other lego or even duplo products.

Also I remember that disassembling it was a pain has it was rather large and if you wanted to put it away you would have to loosen the bolts again.

At least putting it back together was fun.
